summary: This bill, the Sergeant Alfredo ‘Freddy’ Gonzalez Congressional Gold Medal Act, proposes to award a Congressional Gold Medal to Sergeant Alfredo Gonzalez posthumously. The bill acknowledges Gonzalez's heroism during the Vietnam War in February 1968, detailing his actions and military service, culminating in his death in action. It authorizes the Speaker of the House and the President pro tempore of the Senate to arrange the award, directs the Secretary of the Treasury to design and strike the medal, and designates the Museum of South Texas History as the medal's permanent home. The bill also allows for duplicate bronze medals to be sold to cover costs, and addresses the medals' status under U.S. Code.
